name: places/ChIJ58KjFhZZwokR6KDV3S80G7Q
formattedAddress: 57 Hudson River Greenway, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 57 Hudson River Greenway, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
Was recently invited to Market57 for a business meeting and afterwards stayed for lunch.  There were many food stalls to choose from but ultimately decided to try The Galley.  Their kiosk is located near the entrance of Market57.  The menu is small and has some of the more popular items from their flagship location (located two blocks away in Chelsea Market).

I got the Combo Box ($31) which included a Lobster roll, a small cup of New England Clam Chowder and bag of Cape Cod potato chips.  I’m a huge fan of the lobster rolls at their flagship store and the ones here were on par.  It was so very delicious with lots of succulent lobster meat.  The ones here are served in the Connecticut style which is hot and buttery (instead of the cold, mayo-based “Maine” lobster rolls).  I go back and forth on which version I like best; it just really depends on my mood at that moment.  The clam chowder was a great accompaniment to the lobster roll.  It wasn’t the best clam chowder I’ve ever had but it was pretty good and hit the spot.  As for the price, this might be the most I’ve ever spent for one meal in a food hall, but I can’t complain too much as I absolutely enjoyed my meal.

I honestly would recommend this place and Market 57 in general to everyone.  The food and service was great but what tops it for me is that you also have the incredible views of Hudson River Park and Little Island.

originalText.text: Nice service, the food is fresh and tasty, the scallop roll is particularly recommended. The lobster roll is also very good. It's worth a visit. Value for money is justified.

text.text: Nice service, the food is fresh and tasty, the scallop roll is particularly recommended. The lobster roll is also very good. It's worth a visit. Value for money is justified.

originalText.text:
This place was okay! Felt that the lobster wasn't super fresh, portion size was small and it wasn't a "classic" lobster roll. The lobster roll came dressed in some sort of herbacious vinagrette, super heavy on the lemon.

This was unfortunate as we expected either a buttery lobster roll (classic CT style) or even a Maine, mayo based lobster roll would have fit the bill. However, this rendition was just off the mark.

Glad we tried it, appreciate the effort to take a different path for a traditional dish, but just didn't land for me.

originalText.text: Soup was ok but their lobster roll was very disappointing.

originalText.text: Meh, not much meat in my lobster roll. Expected more for the price. Service took 10min for just 2 people.
